releases/0/tender/description:
The Catapult is undertaking an exercise to appoint suitably capable and experienced suppliers to provide recruitment services for its staffing needs including temporary and permanent hires across corporate services, executive hires and project specific resources. 

The Catapult invites expressions of interest and tenders from suppliers with experience across these categories and particularly suppliers with experience in recruiting for industries related to the Future Cities Catapult. 
Suppliers must have an annual turnover above Â£500,000 to meet the mandatory aspects of the Tender.  

The Catapult will not accept any fees higher than 17%. Suppliers submitting rates higher than this will be excluded.

Additional information: To register interest in the opportunity and download the Invitation to Tender, please visit www.fccprocurement.org.uk where you will have to register if you have not used the system before. Once registered, the opportunity can be accessed through reference A9MC-5QUR9M. For queries regarding the portal, please contact the due north help desk via the home page. 

Do not make contact with the Catapult via any other channel of communication regarding this requirement.

The North East Pharmacy Procurement Service wishes to create a framework agreement for the provision and supply of Pharmacy products for home delivery to patients.

releases/0/tender/description:
Text to be corrected in the original notice:
Place of text to be modified: II.2.4)
Instead of: Additional Text
Read: In order to ensure SME Contractors have an opportunity to bid for the Framework, the Cambridgeshire Chamber of Commerce has organised a match making event to link SME Contractors to Consultants who may be able to assist with applications. This event will be held at Greater Peterborough UTC Park Crescent, Peterborough, PE1 4DZ, United Kingdom at 16.00- 18.00 Tuesday May 10th. Please contact Helen Bosett, Sector Co-ordinator, Cambridgeshire Chambers of Commerce at h.bosett@cambscci.co.uk or 01733 370809 to confirm attendance.
Other additional information: In order to ensure SME Contractors have an opportunity to bid for the Framework, the Cambridgeshire Chamber of Commerce has organised a match making event to link SME Contractors to Consultants who may be able to assist with applications. This event will be held at Greater Peterborough UTC Park Crescent, Peterborough, PE1 4DZ, United Kingdom at 16.00- 18.00 Tuesday May 10th. Please contact Helen Bosett, Sector Co-ordinator, Cambridgeshire Chambers of Commerce at h.bosett@cambscci.co.uk
Peterborough City Council (the âAuthorityâ) wishes to alert the construction contractors' market of a future framework opportunity. The Peterborough City Council (PCC) Construction Framework will be seeking suitably experienced Contractors who can deliver construction Works for a wide range of residential, commercial, educational, leisure and regeneration developments in and around Peterborough. 
This PCC Construction Framework will be utilised and owned by Peterborough City Council will run for 4 years. The PCC Construction Framework will be divided into three Lots and the Authority hopes that Small to Medium Enterprises (SMEs) and large construction contractor organisations will respond to this opportunity.
The Authority is leading the way in the public sector procurement in offering opportunities for SME Contractors to deliver Works. It is expected the PCC Construction Framework will provide an excellent opening for SME Contractors in the delivery of Works in Peterborough.
